intro: Secamone axillaris, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its showy, white, nocturnal blooms that open at night and close by dawn. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species, and it produces a milky sap that is toxic. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a hairy texture. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
